messages.message: Created a three classes for three documents respectively. After creating the third class, my second document was reclassified under the third class "billing summary" without notification. I need to click on group by class to see the changes. cc @Serena
Also table extraction only shows partial results as reported before cc @Rakesh
After editing confidence threshold, I cannot save the change. There was a save button before but not anymore. Also no response after hitting enter. cc @Eric Han
Also only says the validation rule fails without telling me what the confidence score is.
Tried this a few times but I am unable to create app
last 2 issues are fixed but not deployed

the save button in the big table rendering case looks like our scrolling is not right in the field editor and pushes the save button out of viewable area
@Serena or @CJ can you take a quick look?
yes, this is fixed on master
@CJ is the scrolling fix for the save button backported to 23.39?
no
(it was bundled with several other big table changes)

> After creating the third class, my second document was reclassified under the third class “billing summary” without notification. I need to click on group by class to see the changes.
after saving your third class, you should have seen a blue dot next to your second document name that indicates it was re-classified

1. did you navigate away or go to another tab while re-classification is occurring? the blue dot goes away after ~10s
2. i don’t think there’s a bug here? we don’t group by class unless the user selects that option - is there something you want to fix here?
@CJ you’re talking about https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/47398, right? what is the relevant scrolling fix for the save button to be seen?
the group by/classify interaction was mentioned by one of the sales engineers too. I think @Natasha is aware and redesigning.
Was just checking with @Natasha and @alagu that we have included notification in the design. @Natasha can you please confirm?
Cc : @Siya

We show indicators for classification updates on each document in all three views (pill or dot depending on real estate).

Sounds like the problem is that the indicators are subtle/easy to miss. To improve discoverability, we could either a) increase the time the indicator stays on for 15-18 seconds or b) keep the indicators until user has scrolled past the doc. @Serena is the second idea possible?

This still doesn't solve the problem of notifying the user. I think we only show a modal if the selected doc's class changes, maybe we can add a toast once all docs are classified? cc @Natasha

> what is the relevant scrolling fix for the save button to be seen?
> 
overflow clip?
maybe on demand classification is good after all :shrug:

Ah I missed the screenshot! Agreed that with 3 documents the scrolling pattern won't help.

What you're proposing is a pattern we see with gmail/slack where user needs to click on the email or thread/channel to dismiss the visual indication. I did consider this and my initial thought was that it is an overkill to make the user select each document for the indicator to go away, and if they don't the UI stays very busy especially in table and thumbnail views.

Let's wait to hear from Bastiane and potentially get more feedback before we make this decision.
I'm also curious if users would move away from the page after clicking on reclassify? If yes, is it because it is an operation that takes time? Might be worth doing mini usability studies!
